auth.loginMessage: Please enter your credentials to access this section
auth.networkError: Network error. Please try again later.

info.adminPanel: Admin Panel: Used to control user accounts, system settings, and monitor the system.
info.downloads: Downloads: The core system for users to access and manage downloads. Note: Setup in the Admin Panel must be completed first.
info.cognitahz: Cognitahz: A proprietary platform for users to consume their downloaded content, combining the best features from various platforms.
info.backups: Backups: Create backup tasks to different services you own or fetch files to your local machine.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Learn the basics of Katomart and get up and running quickly

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Katomart is a comprehensive platform that combines administration, content scraping, intelligent processing, and backup capabilities in one unified system.

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickStart.step1: Access the Admin Panel to configure your system settings and user accounts
quickStart.step2: Set up your scrapers to collect content from various sources
quickStart.step3: Use Cognitahz to intelligently process and consume your content
quickStart.step4: Configure backup tasks to secure your data

systemRequirements.title: System Requirements
systemRequirements.requirement1: Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

courses.title: My Courses
courses.searchPlaceholder: Search by course, module, lesson, or file name...

course.notesPlaceholder: Write your personal notes for this lesson here...

import.title: Import Course
import.subtitle: Add new courses to your learning platform

upload.title: Upload Course Modules
upload.description: Upload ZIP files, each containing a complete module with all its lessons and files
upload.moduleStructureDesc: Each ZIP file should represent one complete module. Organize your files like this:
upload.structureExample3: üìÅ Module3.zip ‚Üí üìÇ Lesson1/, ÔøΩ Lesson2/, ÔøΩ Resources/
upload.dragDrop: Drag and drop ZIP files here, or click to select
upload.noSizeLimit: No file size limit - upload as many modules as needed
upload.zipModuleNote: This ZIP file will be processed as a complete module

url.title: Import from Cloud Storage
url.description: Import course content from cloud storage platforms
url.backupNoticeDesc: If you're trying to import a backup, please use the Backup Panel from the homepage instead.
url.supportedSources: Supported sources: Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, MEGA, Terabox, and other cloud storage services
url.requiresAuthDesc: Check this if the cloud storage link requires login or special permissions to access

telegram.title: Import from Telegram
telegram.description: Import course materials from Telegram channels using different authentication methods
telegram.channelIdHelp: Channel ID is a numeric identifier. Use @username_to_id_bot to find the ID.
telegram.botAuthDesc: Use a bot token for public channels or channels where your bot is an admin
telegram.telethonAuthDesc: Use your own Telegram account authentication (handled by backend)
telegram.botTokenPlaceholder: Enter bot token for channel access
telegram.streamFormatDesc: Import messages and files as individual lessons in streaming format
telegram.zipFormatDesc: Import content organized in ZIP files as complete modules
telegram.filterKeywordsPlaceholder: Enter keywords to filter messages (comma separated)
telegram.instructions: Ensure you have proper access to the channel with your chosen authentication method

folder.title: Select Local Folder
folder.description: Import course materials from a local folder
folder.weakLinkDesc: Create references to files in their current location
folder.strongLinkDesc: Copy files to the application's managed folder
